intro: Clarkia tenella subsp. ambigua, commonly known as the slender clarkia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It has slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
